greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 1 if there is at least one such prime p that p^p divides the arithmetic derivative of n, A003415(n); a(0) = a(1) = 0 by convention.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..65537
formula: a(n) = [A327928(n)>0], where [ ] is the Iverson bracket.
For all n > 1, a(n) >= [A129251(n)>0], i.e., if A129251(n) is nonzero, then certainly a(n) = 1.
program: A003415(n) = {my(fac); if(n<1, 0, fac=factor(n); sum(i=1, matsize(fac)[1], n*fac[i, 2]/fac[i, 1]))}; \\ From A003415
xref: Differs from A327928 for the first time at n=81, where a(81)=1.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Feb 28 2021
